data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كَانُوا comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِيهَا comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.

data.meanings: fire, flame, heat, war, light, shine, sparkle, irritate, vex or provoke war.
data.sentence: The word النَّارُ comes from the root ن و ر and is associated with the meanings: fire, flame, heat, war, light, shine, sparkle, irritate, vex or provoke war.

data.meanings: Pay/give/render a satisfaction, make sufficient, pay a debt, to contend, repay/requit/compensate, to recompense.
data.sentence: The word جَزَاءُ comes from the root ج ز ي and is associated with the meanings: Pay/give/render a satisfaction, make sufficient, pay a debt, to contend, repay/requit/compensate, to recompense.

data.meanings: Pay/give/render a satisfaction, make sufficient, pay a debt, to contend, repay/requit/compensate, to recompense.
data.sentence: The word جَزَاءً comes from the root ج ز ي and is associated with the meanings: Pay/give/render a satisfaction, make sufficient, pay a debt, to contend, repay/requit/compensate, to recompense.

data.meanings: To deny or disacknowledge a thing, to be niggardly or avaricious, poor or possess little good, dissipated or dispersed, little in quantity, scanty.
data.sentence: The word يَجْحَدُونَ comes from the root ج ح د and is associated with the meanings: To deny or disacknowledge a thing, to be niggardly or avaricious, poor or possess little good, dissipated or dispersed, little in quantity, scanty.
The word دَارُ comes from the root د و ر and is associated with the meanings: To go round, revolve, circulate.

data.meanings: To remain/stay/dwell/abode, to remain or continue incessantly/always/endlessly/forever/perpetually, to adorn another with ornaments, to be slow in becoming hoary (when advanced in age), endowed with perpetual vigour
data.sentence: The word الْخُلْدِ comes from the root خ ل د and is associated with the meanings: To remain/stay/dwell/abode, to remain or continue incessantly/always/endlessly/forever/perpetually, to adorn another with ornaments, to be slow in becoming hoary (when advanced in age), endowed with perpetual vigour

data.meanings: to pass by, overlook, transgress, turn aside.. adwun - wickedly, unjustly, spitefully, wrongfully.. adi'yat - companies of warriors, chargers, horses of the warriors, wayfarers who run fast on their journey, swift horses.. aduwatun - enmity. udwan - hostility, injustice. aduwwan (pl. aduwun) - enemy.. . Ya'duuna (impf. 3rd. m. pl.): They transgressed; Programmed.. Laa Ta'du (prt. neg. m. sing.): Do not overlook, not let your eye turn away.. Laa Ta'duu (prt. neg. m. plu.): Do not transgress, violate.. 'Aad (act. pic. m. sing.): Transgressor; Who goes beyond the limits.. 'Aaduuna (act. pic. m. plu.): Transgressors; People who know no limits.. 'Adaytum (prf. 2nd. plu. III.): You are at enmity.. Yat'adda (imp. 3rd. m. sing. V): He trespasses, violates.. I'tadaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing. VIII): Violated.. I'tadan (prf. 3rd. m. plu. VIII.): They transgressed.. I'tadaina (prf. 1st. plu. VIII): We have transgressed.. Ya'taduuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. VIII): They transgressed.. Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. acc. final Nun dropped): You transgress.. Li Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. el.): That you may transgress.. l'taduu (prt. m. plu.): You punish for violence, punish for transgression.. Laa Ta'taduu (prt. neg. m. plu.): You transgress not.. Mu'tadun (ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. Mu'taduun / Mu'tadiin (acc. ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. 'Adwan (v. n. acc.): Transgressing.. 'Aduwwun / 'Aduwwan (acc. v. n.): Enemy.. A'da'un (n. pl.): Enemies.. 'Udwaanun (v. n.): Violence; Punishment of violence; Harshness; Injustice; Transgression.. 'Adaawatun (v. n.): Enmity.. 'Udwatun (n.): Side; End.. 'Adiyaat (act. pic. f. plu.): Panting; Running; Coursers..
data.sentence: The word أَعْدَاءِ comes from the root ع د و and is associated with the meanings: to pass by, overlook, transgress, turn aside.. adwun - wickedly, unjustly, spitefully, wrongfully.. adi'yat - companies of warriors, chargers, horses of the warriors, wayfarers who run fast on their journey, swift horses.. aduwatun - enmity. udwan - hostility, injustice. aduwwan (pl. aduwun) - enemy.. . Ya'duuna (impf. 3rd. m. pl.): They transgressed; Programmed.. Laa Ta'du (prt. neg. m. sing.): Do not overlook, not let your eye turn away.. Laa Ta'duu (prt. neg. m. plu.): Do not transgress, violate.. 'Aad (act. pic. m. sing.): Transgressor; Who goes beyond the limits.. 'Aaduuna (act. pic. m. plu.): Transgressors; People who know no limits.. 'Adaytum (prf. 2nd. plu. III.): You are at enmity.. Yat'adda (imp. 3rd. m. sing. V): He trespasses, violates.. I'tadaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing. VIII): Violated.. I'tadan (prf. 3rd. m. plu. VIII.): They transgressed.. I'tadaina (prf. 1st. plu. VIII): We have transgressed.. Ya'taduuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. VIII): They transgressed.. Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. acc. final Nun dropped): You transgress.. Li Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. el.): That you may transgress.. l'taduu (prt. m. plu.): You punish for violence, punish for transgression.. Laa Ta'taduu (prt. neg. m. plu.): You transgress not.. Mu'tadun (ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. Mu'taduun / Mu'tadiin (acc. ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. 'Adwan (v. n. acc.): Transgressing.. 'Aduwwun / 'Aduwwan (acc. v. n.): Enemy.. A'da'un (n. pl.): Enemies.. 'Udwaanun (v. n.): Violence; Punishment of violence; Harshness; Injustice; Transgression.. 'Adaawatun (v. n.): Enmity.. 'Udwatun (n.): Side; End.. 'Adiyaat (act. pic. f. plu.): Panting; Running; Coursers..
